definition: (of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)

sentences.english: He decided that he must make some accomplishment and then marry her grandly.
sentences.chinese: 他一定要幹出名堂來，然後風風光光迎娶她。

sentences.english: He married Princess Wencheng of the Tang Dynasty who believed in Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 他迎娶了唐朝信佛的文成公主。

sentences.english: Should I be along all my life? Or should Baal marry me?
sentences.chinese: 難道我要孤老終生，或是讓萬能的太陽神來迎娶我？

sentences.english: There waiting to marry the Tibetan King Songtsan the Tang Dynasty emperor's daughter.
sentences.chinese: 那裏有吐蕃王松贊干布等待迎娶這位唐朝皇帝的女兒。

sentences.english: The couple, Bin Laden's son Omar and his British wife Zaina, married in 2007.
sentences.chinese: 2007年，本拉登之子奧馬爾迎娶了英國人扎娜。

sentences.english: King Songtsan Gampo built this palace to marry Princess Wencheng from Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 松贊干布建這個宮殿是爲了迎娶唐朝的文成公主。

sentences.english: The littlest knight married her and got half the kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 小小騎士迎娶了公主，分得半壁江山。

sentences.english: When YiHeng indignation unceasingly, sanshui YiHeng proposed to marry snow Joe.
sentences.chinese: 當乙恆憤恨不已時，三水向乙恆提出迎娶雪喬。

sentences.english: Best for morning and evening event.
sentences.chinese: 早上的迎娶和晚上的囍宴都很適合。

definition: (of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to break a promise of marriage
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
